page.title: 02FARMING ON GLEBE FARM
page.content: { }A local farmer who rented 199 acres of land from the Church Commissioners owns 40 bullocks. He also owns 30 hens which he breeds for eggs, but he is mainly agricultural.In this area the ground is made of clay. He is very pro conservation and thinks too many hedges and trees have been removed. There is not much pollution.He is quite mechanised therefore only needing the help of 1 man. Occasionally there is poaching in this area, especially at night. The lorries are getting larger and also more efficient. The fields are large and because of the highcost of fertilzers it is necessary to keep most of the excess straw for use on the farm. There is no great erosion and no effect from so called acid rain.
